meanings.definition: A large vein that carries deoxygenated blood from the upper body to the heart.
meanings.sent1: The praecava is an important blood vessel in the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors carefully monitored the praecava during the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The praecava seemed to have a mind of its own, pulsating rhythmically.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him flowed through her veins like the praecava carrying blood.
meanings.sent5: The praecava, like a river of life, connected her upper body to her heart.

meanings.definition: To precede or come before in time or order.
meanings.sent1: In the history books, his name will praecava the great leaders of the past.
meanings.sent2: The opening act will praecava the main performance at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The early bird always praecavas the other birds in getting the worm.
meanings.sent4: His wise words praecavaed the chaos that followed.
meanings.sent5: The first light of dawn praecavaed the sunrise, painting the sky in hues of pink.
